title: A school to remember Malayalam writer Vaikom Muhammad Basheer with 52 story telling sessions in 52 classrooms
content: Students of SNDP HSS, Udayamperoor, will tell a 10-minute-long story each of the late writer in their respective classrooms before the class hours on July 7

title: From Kashmir to Kamakhya, cooperatives need new work culture, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home Minister Amit Shah was addressing the fourth foundation day celebrations of Ministry of Cooperation at Amul Dairy in Anand

title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah says he is not aware of being named to head the party’s OBC panel
content: “I do not know about it. Even I saw it in papers. I will speak to the high command today [to seek clarity] on the issue,” the Chief Minister said

title: Cheque bounce case acquittals can be challenged before district courts from July 7: Madras High Court
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan dispenses with the practice of filing the appeals in the High Court along with petitions seeking the leave of the court to file the appeals

title: One killed, five injured in yet another fireworks accident in Virudhunagar district
content: The police said the body of the deceased was ripped apart and firemen and police collected parts of his body from different places

title: U.K. Royal Air Force team lands in Kerala to repair grounded F-35B
content: The Royal Air Force aircraft that brought the expert team to Kerala will return by evening. The team will stay here a few days exploring the possibility of repairing the grounded aircraft

title: Amici Curiae object to erection of steel wire rope fencing in Thondamuthur to prevent human-elephant conflicts
content: They tell Madras High Court that a scientific study must be undertaken on the impact it could have on the movement of elephants

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra moves Supreme Court against EC's revision of electoral rolls in Bihar
content: Mahua Moitra said she seeks setting aside of the order dated June 24 under which Special Intensive Revision (SIR) is being conducted in alleged violation of various provisions of the Constitution

title: Kottayam hospital building collapse: Kerala Health Minister Veena George meets Bindu’s family
content: Accompanied by some CPI(M) leaders and amidst heavy police presence, the Minister arrived at Bindu’s residence in Thalayolaparambu at around 7:10 a.m

title: Major relief to voters, EC makes big decision on documents ahead of Assembly elections in Bihar
content: If voters are unable to provide the required documents, the Electoral Registration Officer (ERO) can take a decision on the basis of local investigation or other documentary evidence.

title: Anti-rabies vaccination drive: 17,000 doses ready in Andhra Pradesh’s Kadapa district
content: Launching an anti-rabies vaccination drive on the occasion of ‘World Zoonosis Day’ at the veterinary polyclinic in Kadapa, district Collector Sridhar Cherukuri called upon pet owners to make use of the facility

title: Supreme Court administration writes to Centre, seeks vacating of designated official residence of CJI currently occupied by ex-CJI Chandrachud
content: Under Rule 3B of the Supreme Court Judges (Amendment) Rules, 2022, a retired Chief Justice of India can retain type VII bungalow, a level below the 5, Krishna Menon Marg bungalow, for a maximum period of six months post-retirement

title: Let Marathi language, culture echo far and wide: Ajit Pawar
content: The Deputy CM said, “Let the flag of Maharashtra’s progress fly high with pride. May the State witness prosperity, unity and strength by moving forward collectively”

title: Several Sena (UBT) MPs, MLAs in touch with me: BJP leader Girish Mahajan
content: Girish Mahajan alleged that Uddhav Thackeray was a palatibahaddar and his conduct was immature, amid the controversy over the implementation of the three-language policy in the State

title: Red alert issued in Himachal Pradesh for Sunday
content: It also warned of low to moderate flash-flood risk in parts of five districts of Chamba, Kangra, Mandi, Shimla and Sirmaur in the next 24 hours

title: Executive Directors can be included in CIBIL list if company defaults loans: Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh refuses to interfere with the inclusion of Zylog Systems director Srikanth Parthasarathy in the wilful defaulters list

title: After two months’ search, Kerala’s ‘man-eater’ tiger captured at Karuvarakundu
content: Over the past few weeks, local residents had spotted an aged frail tiger roaming various parts of Karuvarakundu. And it fuelled growing unrest as the hunt for the tiger dragged on with no results

title: Fix timeline for notifying fresh list of elephant corridors in Tamil Nadu, Madras High Court directs State government
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy also want to know the progress made so far in this regard

title: Madras High Court suo motu impleads Mata Amritanandamayi Math in forest case
content: It relates to alleged erection of a two-kilometre-long electric fence disturbing movement of elephants on Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham campus in Ettimadai

title: Two militants arrested, explosives recovered in Manipur
content: Intelligence-based search operations and cordons are being widely carried out to apprehend those involved in extortion and criminal activities in the State

title: BJP, Nitish Kumar made Bihar crime capital of India: Rahul Gandhi on Gopal Khemka’s murder in Patna
content: It’s been more than 36 hours, however, police have not made any breakthrough in the case. Gopal Khemka’s younger brother Shankar accused the State government of running organised crime

title: News in Frames | Kolhapuri chappals walk on chic runways
content: Rooted in centuries-old craftsmanship, these eco-friendly, handmade sandals stand as a proud symbol of India’s artisanal heritage and sustainable fashion

title: Hundreds of red-robed monks and nuns braved incessant rain as Dalai Lama describes himself as a ‘simple Buddhist monk’
content: Hundreds of red-robed monks and nuns braved incessant rain and poured through the narrow streets of Dharamshala to make their way towards the main Dalai Lama temple

title: Dalai Lama turns 90 after week of celebrations and vows to keep defying China for years
content: The Nobel laureate is regarded as one of the world's most influential religious leaders, with a following that extends well beyond Buddhism

title: Hizbul supremo among 11 chargesheeted in cross-border narco-terror case by J&K State Investigation Agency
content: The others were identified as Khalid Hussain of Rajouri, Mohd Shokit of Poonch, Javid Ahmed Rather of Budgam, Manzoor Ahmad and Asif Rehman Reshi of Srinagar and Harpreet Singh, Chain Singh, Sahil Kumar, and Sandeepak Singh of Jammu, the official said.

title: Kolkata gangrape: Prime accused Monojit drank after the crime, did not try to hide, say police
content: Eleven criminal cases have surfaced against the Monojit Mishra which involves vandalising college and assault. The governing body of the college had the law graduate as a contractual employee in the college.

title: Sivaganga custodial death: Where police run kangaroo courts
content: The custodial torture and murder of Ajith Kumar, a young security guard at a temple in Sivaganga district, have prompted protests across the State. The sheer brutality of the violence and the deliberate abandonment of due procedure have eroded public faith in the police as custodians of peace and law and order. C. Palanivel Rajan does a deep dive to unravel this horrific, distorted tale

title: Sandeshkhali violence: CBI takes over probe, registers FIR against accused TMC leader Shahjahan Sheikh
content: Justice Joy Sengupta has ordered the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to constitute a special investigation team (SIT) to probe the case with “utmost seriousness”

title: Tension prevails at Ragi Gudda in Shivamogga, following alleged displacement of idols
content: An incident of displacement of Nagara Vigraha (serpent idol) at Bangarappa Layout near Ragi Gudda in Shivamogga Rural Police Station limits occurred

title: M.P.: Culvert collapses on Narsinghpur-Narmadapuram Highway after heavy rainfall
content: The culvert was built over Sukhchain river near Bandesur village in Gadarwara subdivision of Narsinghpur district

title: Water project to benefit parts of Chikkamagaluru, Chitradurga, irks farmers in Davangere
content: The Bhadra Reservoir Project, overall, intends to irrigate over 1.05 lakh hectares spread over Chikkamagaluru, Shivamogga and Davangere districts

title: A.P. govt. pursuing proposal with Centre to set up Mango Board in Chittoor, says official
content: The government will soon release ₹8 crore towards clearing the dues of the pulp processing units, says Principal Secretary for Food Processing

title: Elevated gridlock: Traffic crawls through Gachibowli’s newest flyover
content: Designed as a six-lane elevated corridor linking the Outer Ring Road (ORR) to the city’s IT corridor, the P. Janardhan Reddy (PJR) flyover is seeing daily volumes of up to 75,000 vehicles; this has shifted the pressure onto narrower linking stretches, with bumper-to-bumper traffic stretching onto the flyover

title: India becomes fourth ‘most equal’ country globally
content: India’s Gini Index score stands at 25.5, with only Slovak Republic, Slovenia and Belarus faring better

title: 12-year-old girl gang-raped, murdered in Uttar Pradesh village, four booked
content: The incident has sparked protests, with villagers and leaders of Bhim Army and various other political parties demanding swift action

title: Soaring prices of coconut, coconut oil disrupts budgets of small-time eateries, households
content: Coconut prices cross ₹80 per kg and oil shoots past ₹400 a litre; drop in production, growing global exports, and rising demand for puja and related rituals push rates up

title: Electoral roll revision: Lakhs in Bihar may lose vote, ADR tells SC
content: The Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) has challenged the Election Commission's special intensive revision (SIR) of Bihar's electoral rolls in the Supreme Court, arguing it could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly from marginalized communities. ADR contends the SIR's documentation requirements disproportionately affect vulnerable populations, as Aadhaar and ration cards are not accepted.

title: Pune techie rape case: Top cop says 22-year-old woman filed false complaint
content: Pune Police have dismissed a rape allegation made by a 22-year-old data scientist as a fabrication intended to mislead authorities. Commissioner Amitesh Kumar stated the woman's report, claiming assault by a delivery agent, was false. Investigations revealed inconsistencies within 24 hours, including a manipulated selfie and a self-authored threatening message. The man in the selfie was known to her.

title: 'Criminal offence' - Yograj tears into Shubman Gill for missing triple century
content: Yograj Singh took a dig at India’s Test captain Shubman Gill for missing out on a well-deserved triple century in the second Test against England at the Edgbaston Cricket Ground in Birmingham.  Gill began the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series with a sublime 147 in the first innings of the first Test at Headingley in Leeds. However, despite his century, India went on to lose that game by five wickets.

title: SC seeks removal of ex-CJI Chandrachud from official residence 'without delay'
content: The Supreme Court administration has formally requested the Centre to reclaim the official residence of former CJI DY Chandrachud, as his permitted occupancy has exceeded the deadline.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years; country manager says: This is more than a...
content: Microsoft is set to implement significant layoffs, primarily impacting its sales and marketing division, as part of an ongoing restructuring effort amid substantial AI investments. This move coincides with Chief Commercial Officer Judson Althoff's planned eight-week sabbatical, scheduled to conclude in September. The layoffs represent the third major workforce reduction this year for the tech giant.

title: Dalai Lama cannot decide on reincarnation, says China; India maintains neutrality
content: China's ambassador asserts that the Dalai Lama lacks authority over the reincarnation system, a practice spanning 700 years. This statement contrasts with India's stance of non-interference in religious matters, as Kiren Rijiju emphasizes the Dalai Lama's sole right to decide on his reincarnation. The Tibetan government-in-exile accuses China of cultural genocide.

title: ‘Skirts or jeans?’: 40 MP temples ask women to 'view from outside' if not in dress code
content: Posters have appeared outside approximately 40 temples in Jabalpur, requesting women to dress in accordance with Indian culture. The Mahakal Sangh International Bajrang Dal issued the appeal, discouraging attire like miniskirts and jeans-tops inside temples. This sparked debate, with women's rights activists like Ranjana Kurariya asserting the right to choose one's clothing.

title: 'Disneyland in Haryana?' Ex-Jet Airways CEO reacts to dirty Gurugram streets
content: Former Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor criticised Gurugram’s civic mess, sharing images of garbage-filled streets and cows amid trash in sector 44. Calling the Haryana Disneyland plan “ludicrous,” he tagged local authorities and PM Modi, urging Swachh Bharat action. His posts sparked strong reactions from residents, echoing frustration over poor waste management and lack of basic civic upkeep.

title: Avoid entering US via airport, instead fly into ...; reads Harvard University advisory
content: Harvard University has advised international students, especially those from Iran and China, to avoid Boston's Logan Airport due to increased scrutiny. The university suggests alternative entry points like New York's JFK and cautions students about their social media activity and electronic device content. This advice follows tensions between Harvard and the Trump administration regarding international student enrollment and research funding.

title: Electoral roll revision: EC relaxes voter roll norms in Bihar, documents can follow later
content: Amid opposition's 'votebandi' claims, the Election Commission has eased voter registration rules in Bihar. Voters can now submit forms without required documents initially, addressing concerns about potential disenfranchisement before upcoming elections. This follows opposition objections to the intensive electoral roll revision, fearing many voters could lose their right to vote.

title: 'He wants son-in-law treatment': Gambhir calls out India star’s ‘demanding attitude’ – Watch
content: Gautam Gambhir, known for his serious demeanour, surprised fans with his humour on The Kapil Sharma Show. He playfully confirmed Hardik Pandya's 'demanding attitude' and explained his serious persona as a necessary role for team success. Gambhir emphasised his on-field intensity stems from his dedication to the country, revealing a lighter side to the committed coach.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: Nagpur underworld on edge after woman’s mystery death
content: A gangster's wife's accidental death in Nagpur, linked to an affair with another gang member, ignited a feud within the Ippa gang. Arshad Topi, the lover, is now a target, seeking police protection as the gang seeks revenge, suspecting foul play in the woman's death. Police are on high alert to prevent further violence.

title: Reuters X handle blocked in India over 'legal demand'
content: Reuters' main X account has been withheld in India following a legal demand, according to a notice on the platform. Government sources deny issuing any new demand recently, citing a previous request during "Operation Sindoor" that led to the blocking of numerous accounts. X, formerly Twitter, appears to have acted on this older request, while affiliated Reuters accounts remain accessible.

title: 'Not against Hindi': Sanjay Raut distances from Stalin's 'support'
content: Sanjay Raut clarifies Shiv Sena (UBT)'s stance on Hindi, distinguishing it from Tamil Nadu's outright rejection. Maharashtra opposes mandatory Hindi in primary schools, not the language itself, unlike the southern state's broader resistance.

title: Honeymoon nightmare: Newly-weds duped of Rs 7.6L for Europe trip
content: A newly-wed couple from Kolkata was allegedly cheated by a travel agency. They lost Rs 7.6 lakh. The agency cancelled their Europe honeymoon trip just before the wedding. Police are investigating the fraud. Similar scams have occurred recently. Authorities advise caution when booking travel packages. Verify agency credentials and avoid full advance payments. Report suspicious offers to the police.

title: 'How Epaminondas beat Spartans': Musk launches 'America Party' to fight 'uniparty'
content: Elon Musk has announced the formation of 'The America Party,' inspired by ancient Greek military strategy, aiming to disrupt the perceived 'uniparty' system in American politics. Musk criticized President Trump's tax-cut and spending bill, labeling it "debt slavery," and vowed to challenge the status quo. He also hinted at a potential run for office next year.

title: ‘Was forced to bury bodies for years’: Karnataka ex-sanitation worker’s chilling claim
content: A former sanitation worker in Dharmasthala has filed a police complaint, alleging he was coerced into secretly disposing of multiple dead bodies over several years. He claims to have exhumed skeletal remains from burial sites, submitting photographs as evidence.

title: IND v ENG: Big milestone! Rishabh Pant scripts SENA history with explosive knock
content: Rishabh Pant etched his name in cricket history, becoming the first Asian wicketkeeper-batter to surpass 2,000 Test runs in SENA countries. His aggressive 65 in the Edgbaston Test against England underscored his impact. Pant's Edgbaston innings also saw him break the record for most sixes by a visiting batter in England, with 24 sixes.

title: ‘Hidden camera linked to Wi-Fi’: Lucknow landlord booked for spying in tenant's bathroom
content: In Lucknow, a landlord faces accusations of installing a hidden camera in his female tenant's bathroom, allegedly connecting it to Wi-Fi for live viewing. The tenant discovered the device on June 24th. Upon confronting the landlord, she alleges he attempted to rape her and threatened her family if she reported the incident.

title: Man ends life over wife's character, unaware she died earlier; children orphaned
content: In a tragic turn of events in Patiala, Gurmeet Singh died by suicide, unaware that his wife, Manpreet Kaur, had already taken her own life days earlier due to constant quarrels and his unfounded suspicions. Manpreet left home with their children after an argument, and her body was later found in the Bhakra canal.

title: Savannah James gives peek into daughter Zhuri’s lavish bedroom; makes hilarious parenting claim
content: Savannah James shared a glimpse into her daughter Zhuri's lavishly decorated room on Instagram, humorously revealing that Zhuri never actually sleeps there. The video captured Zhuri's playful bedtime routine, which included climbing on her bed's wooden structure, prompting a lighthearted exchange with her mother. Amidst family changes, Savannah balances her roles, prioritizing family life and advocating for self-care.

title: ‘Massive’ $49M deal: Nazem Kadri sparks Toronto Maple Leafs reunion rumors
content: Nazem Kadri's potential return to the Toronto Maple Leafs is stirring NHL trade rumors, complicated by his $49 million contract with the Calgary Flames. While Calgary might consider a trade, Toronto's salary cap and roster dynamics make a reunion unlikely. Kadri's age and contract pose challenges, despite his potential leadership and playoff experience.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs’ Europe trip; drops cryptic 3-word message
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: US-India trade deal: Industry ready for any outcome, says CII chief
content: As the deadline for US-imposed reciprocal tariffs approaches, Indian industry prepares for any outcome from trade talks. CII President Rajiv Memani emphasizes India's commitment to national interests, stating that any agreement must benefit both nations. While a deal could boost sectors like IT and pharma, failure may impact automotive and garment industries, highlighting the need for enhanced competitiveness.

title: Watch: Swimmers narrowly escape falling boulders at Utah waterfall
content: A shocking incident at Utah's Lower Calf Creek Falls saw swimmers narrowly escape injury when large boulders suddenly crashed down near them. The Bureau of Land Management (BLM) Utah video went viral, highlighting the dangers of the popular swimming spot. While no one was hurt in this incident, authorities are urging caution due to the risk of falling rocks.

title: AI robots fill in for weed killers and farm hands
content: Oblivious to the punishing midday heat, a wheeled robot powered by the sun and infused with artificial intelligence carefully combs a cotton field in California, plucking out weeds. - Aigen has robots running in tomato, cotton, and sugar beet fields, and touts the technology's ability to weed without damaging the crops.

title: 'Blessed by his presence in our country': Rijiju attends Dalai Lama’s 90th birthday
content: Union minister Kiren Rijiju attended the Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations in Dharamshala, emphasizing his role as a bridge between ancient wisdom and the modern world. The Dalai Lama reflected on benefiting others from exile in India. Amid succession debates, Rijiju affirmed India's support for the Dalai Lama's institution's decisions, rejecting external interference, particularly from China.

title: Musk launches ‘America Party’: Can he run for president in 2028?
content: Elon Musk has unveiled his 'America Party,' challenging the existing two-party system amidst a strained relationship with Donald Trump. Despite constitutional ineligibility for the presidency due to his African birth, Musk aims to disrupt the political landscape. A recent poll on X revealed strong public support for a new party, prompting Musk to action.

title: Tourists may soon have to pre-register Mussoorie trip
content: To combat overcrowding and traffic congestion, Dehradun authorities plan to introduce a pre-registration system for tourists visiting Mussoorie during peak seasons. The system, prompted by a doubling of visitors between 2022 and 2024, will require tourists to register online and obtain a QR code for entry. Those without valid registration may be denied access at key checkpoints.

title: IND vs ENG: Rishabh Pant silences Harry Brook’s ‘fastest 100’ quip - WATCH
content: During the Edgbaston Test, England's Harry Brook attempted to unsettle Rishabh Pant with playful sledging, questioning his fastest century. Pant, unfazed, responded calmly, focusing on his game. He then scored a crucial 65 off 58 balls, contributing to a significant partnership with Shubman Gill, who made 161.

title: Plane violates restriction above Trump's golf course; escorted out by F-16
content: A NORAD fighter jet intercepted a civilian aircraft that violated restricted airspace over Bedminster, New Jersey, where President Trump was celebrating the 4th of July weekend. The incident, which occurred on Saturday afternoon, was one of several airspace violations that day. NORAD safely escorted the aircraft out of the restricted zone, as it continues to safeguard North American airspace.

title: Good news! Railway passengers may get higher refund cancelled train tickets
content: Indian Railways is considering reducing or eliminating 'clerkage' fees deducted from cancelled waitlisted tickets, potentially benefiting passengers. This move comes as online bookings increase and operational costs decrease. Simultaneously, Railways will require identity verification for Tatkal bookings starting July 1, 2025, using Aadhaar or DigiLocker.

title: India vs England, Day 5 Weather Update: Rain likely to play spoilsport
content: The India versus England second Test match at Edgbaston faces weather concerns. Shubman Gill's impressive batting and Siraj and Akash Deep's bowling put India in a strong position. India needs to level the series. England requires a massive 608 runs to win. Rain is expected on Sunday, potentially affecting play and favoring seam bowlers. The match hangs in the balance.

title: 'Dhurandhar' teaser: Ranveer Singh's avatar breaks internet- watch
content: On Ranveer Singh's birthday, the teaser for 'Dhurandhar' was released, creating a buzz online. The film, directed by Aditya Dhar and starring R Madhavan, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal, and Akshaye Khanna, features intense action with comedic elements.

title: Gopal Khemka murder: Rahul Gandhi calls Bihar ‘India’s crime capital’
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP-led NDA government and Nitish Kumar after businessman Gopal Khemka's murder in Patna, labeling Bihar as India's crime capital. Khemka was shot dead near Gandhi Maidan, prompting the formation of a Special Investigation Team. This incident echoes the 2018 killing of Khemka's son, a BJP leader, raising concerns about the state's law and order situation.

title: Wimbledon: Djokovic’s daughter steals spotlight with adorable dance | Watch
content: Novak Djokovic celebrated his 100th Wimbledon singles win on Centre Court, but his daughter, Tara, stole the show. During an on-court interview, Djokovic explained a dance he's been doing is to the song "Pump It Up." He then encouraged Tara to demonstrate, and she happily obliged, pumping her fists to the delight of the crowd.

title: Himachal monsoon havoc: 74 dead; IMD issues red alert
content: Torrential monsoon rains have caused widespread devastation in Himachal Pradesh, resulting in 74 deaths and leaving dozens missing. Rescue operations are underway in the Mandi district, the worst-hit area, where teams are struggling with challenging terrain to locate those trapped. A red alert has been issued for more heavy rainfall, exacerbating the already dire situation.

title: Groom, 2 toddlers among 9 dead as speeding car rams into wall in UP
content: A tragic accident occurred in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district. A speeding car carrying wedding attendees crashed into a wall. Nine people died, including the groom. Preliminary investigations suggest the driver's negligence caused the accident. Authorities are investigating the incident. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed their condolences. Financial assistance was announced for the victims' families.

title: Who is Rajan Kabra? CA final AIR 1 also topped Intermediate; sets record-breaking streak
content: Rajan Kabra from Mumbai achieved AIR 1 in the CA Final May 2025 exams, scoring 516/600. His success highlights a journey driven by curiosity and a balanced approach, contrasting with rote learning methods. The ICAI also announced results for Intermediate and Foundation exams, showcasing the rigorous standards of the CA qualification process, with varying pass rates across different groups.

title: No Wi-Fi at Kolkata airport for 7 months: Flyers land in digital dead zone
content: Kolkata Airport is facing criticism for the lack of Wi-Fi service in the arrival lounge since November, leaving international passengers stranded without internet connectivity. This absence prevents them from contacting hosts, booking transportation, or accessing essential travel information. Airport officials acknowledge the issue and are working to restore Wi-Fi and explore the possibility of a SIM card retail outlet.

title: 10-hour workdays allowed in Telangana: Overtime pay for anything beyond 48 hours/week
content: The Telangana government has approved increasing working hours for commercial establishments to 10 hours daily, while maintaining the 48-hour weekly limit. Employees working beyond this limit are entitled to overtime wages. The new rule, effective upon gazette publication on July 8, aims to promote ease of doing business, with potential extensions considered for factories.

title: All eyes on India as Brics takes up US tariffs, Israel
content: The Brics summit in Rio is set to address global concerns, with the declaration expected to reflect India's stance on terrorism while urging a stronger position on US tariffs and Israel's actions in Gaza. Negotiations are ongoing, with proposals including condemnation of US tariffs and concerns about the situation in Palestinian territory, potentially posing challenges for India's diplomatic balancing act.

title: 'If he gets …': Shastri makes bold prediction as Suryavanshi slams fastest ton
content: Ravi Shastri has lauded 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, hinting at a possible fast-track to the Indian national team after his record-breaking 143 against England U-19. Suryavanshi's explosive innings, including the fastest Youth ODI century, has cemented his status as a generational talent. His prior IPL exploits further highlight his potential for rapid advancement in cricket.

title: Congress Recalls Dalai Lama's 4-Hour Conversation With Nehru In 1959
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh shared a picture of Jawaharlal Nehru with Dalai Lama from April 24, 1959, when the two had a four-long conversation in Mussoorie.

title: "Irrational": Delhi Lt Governor Slams Order On End-Of-Life Vehicles
content: It is irrational to imagine that a 10-year-old diesel vehicle has reached its end of life despite remaining roadworthy in Delhi, Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has said.

title: Centre Responds After News Agency Reuters' X Account Withheld In India
content: There has been "no requirement" from the Indian government to withhold the Reuters' X handle, the Centre has said, denying any role in the international news agency's social media account being withheld in the country.

title: Rahul Gandhi's "Crime Capital" Jab At BJP, Nitish Kumar After Patna Murder
content: In a scathing attack on the Bihar government over the murder of businessman Gopal Khemka in Patna, Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, has said the BJP and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar have turned Bihar into India's "crime capital"

title: Serial Killer On The Run For 24 Years Arrested. He Targeted Cab Drivers
content: A serial killer who targeted cab drivers and sold off their vehicles has landed in the police net after 24 years. The Delhi Police crime branch has arrested Ajay Lamba, who was wanted in four murder-cum-robbery cases.

title: Video Shows Land Disappear Within Minutes In Devastating Texas Floods
content: Rescuers searched Saturday for 27 missing girls who were swept away by devastating floods in Central Texas of United States, as the death toll jumped over 50, with the likelihood of finding more survivors appearing to diminish.

title: 2 Days After BJP Leader Gopal Khemka's Murder, A Request From His Son
content: Gaurav Khemka, son of businessman Gopal Khemka who was shot dead near the main gate of his residence in Patna's Gandhi Maidan area, has requested police protection for his family, citing a previous family tragedy and fear for their lives.

title: "People Should Not Be Divided": Kangana Ranaut Amid Marathi vs Hindi Row
content: Amid the language debate in Maharashtra, BJP MP and actor Kangana Ranaut has said the country's unity must be preserved and people should not be divided in the name of language.

title: Gujarat AAP MLA Chaitar Vasava Arrested On Attempt To Murder Charges
content: Gujarat AAP MLA Chaitar Vasava has been arrested on charges of attempt to murder after he allegedly attacked a taluka panchayat functionary at Dediapada in Narmada district, police said on Sunday.

title: Rights Body Flags 'Lapses' In Bhopal College Rape, Blackmail Cases
content: Allegations of drugging, rape, blackmailing and forced religious conversions of students at a private engineering college in Bhopal have raised serious concerns.

title: How A Suspicious Invite Forced Dalai Lama To Flee Tibet And Escape To India
content: On afrigid night over six decades ago, as artillery fire echoed in the distance and Chinese forces encircled the Tibetan capital of Lhasa, a 23-year-old monk disguised as a soldier slipped quietly out of his palace. He was no ordinary monk.

title: Antique Coins And Rs 2 Crore Promise: Man, 60, Shoots Self Over Cyber Scam
content: A 60-year-old retired security guard in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa city shot himself with his licensed gun after falling prey to an elaborate cyber scam that promised crores in exchange for antique coins.

title: "My Father's Dream Has Come True": Chief Justice BR Gavai Gets Emotional
content: Chief Justice of India BhushanRamkrishna Gavai on Saturday recalled his father's dream of seeing him become a judge, saying that dream has now come true.

title: 40 Gangsters Hunt Rogue Member After Leader's Wife Dies In Secret Affair
content: A member of a notorious gang falls in love with his chief's wife. The two clandestinely step outside for a romantic tryst when the woman gets killed in an accident. And then, all hell breaks loose in the gang.

title: Siddaramaiah Aide Asks People To Choose: Guarantees Or Development
content: Choose either election guarantees or development - a close aide of Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah told a public rally yesterday, risking a fresh political flashpoint amid an apparent power struggle in the southern state's ruling dispensation.

title: "India Doesn't Work Under Pressure": Industry Body Ahead Of US Trade Deal
content: India does not take any decision under pressure from any country, Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) National President Rajiv Memani has said, asserting that New Delhi's interest will always be a priority as it nears a trade deal with Washington.

title: India's $70 Million Ticket To Space Redefines A Global Collaboration
content: With India's nearly $70 million investment leap, Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla's space mission ignites global space commerce.

title: In Mumbai, A Same Sex Relationship Ends In Minor Boy's 'Cold Drink' Murder
content: A same-sex relationship between two teenagers in Mumbai has ended in a grisly murder. The 19-year-old accused has been arrested after the father of his 16-year-old partner alleged that the accused spiked a cold drink, and the minor died of poisoning.

title: Soldier Dies Of Bullet Injury From His Own Rifle In J&Ks Rajouri
content: It was not immediately clear whether the soldier died of suicide or accidental discharge from his rifle, the officials said.

title: PM Modi arrives in Brazil for four-day visit, to attend BRICS Summit
content: In his departure statement, Mr. Modi said that as a founding member of BRICS, India is committed to the bloc as a vital platform for cooperation among emerging economies

title: Call for gender parity in higher judiciary: Women lawyers advocate 50% reservation
content: Senior Advocates of the Karnataka High Court and other members emphasized the urgent need for meaningful representation of women in the judiciary to promote gender equality and justice.

title: July 9 strike against Centre’s policies; for workers and unemployed: Amarjeet Kaur
content: Senior trade union leader says investment is not coming to India because Centre favoured two companies, not because of workers

title: BJP slams Uddhav Thackeray over remarks on Patel community in Gujarat
content: He further accused the BJP of employing similar tactics in Haryana and Maharashtra, alleging that the party incited Jats and Marathas, respectively, to consolidate other communities in its favor.

title: My father Ram Vilas Paswan was a powerful voice of the poor, says Chirag Paswan on birth anniversary
content: The main function was organised in Hajipur, the Lok Sabha seat which Ram Vilas Paswan won eight times; at present, this seat is represented by his son Chirag who garlanded a statue installed near Hajipur Circuit House

title: What are the lessons from Telangana blast? | Explained
content: What are the safety and quality concerns, particularly in smaller pharmaceutical firms? Are regulatory checks not being carried out? What are the protocols to be followed? Are pollution norms being adhered to? How big is the pharma market?

title: Why is Maharashtra debating over Hindi? | Explained
content: Why is there resistance to introducing Hindi as the third language in primary education in government schools? What has the State government decided on the three-language policy? What does the National Education Policy, 2020 lay down?

title: FIR lodged over ‘violations’ during Muharram procession in Srinagar
content: The procession was carried out by Shia Muslims from the city centre Lal Chowk on Friday, July 4, amid tight security; the police did not divulge details about the action for which the FIR was lodged

title: Bhanupali-Bilaspur-Beri railway line project: HC issues notice to Centre, H.P. govt. over fissures in houses
content: Villagers have reported big cracks in their homes due to the construction of the tunnel, which is located just 10 metres from some residences, the petition stated

title: Anti-Hindi war creates a storm in Maharashtra, says CM Stalin
content: CM Stalin stated that the BJP government, which had made teaching Hindi a precondition for allocating funds to Tamil Nadu, backed down after the people of Maharashtra raised their voices against Hindi imposition

title: E-vehicle charging station operators disappointed over revision in electricity fixed charges
content: In the recent tariff order, fixed charges for EV charging stations under LT–VII tariff category in the above 50-112 kW slab have been increased to ₹165 per kW per month when compared to the previous tariff of ₹79 per kW per month

title: Reorganising States into smaller units key to fair delimitation, says expert
content: He highlights the disparity in the value of votes across constituencies, citing a comparison between the Chennai Central and Bangalore North Lok Sabha seats as an example of imbalance

title: Maoists are fighting for rights of the marginalised, says Thirumavalavan
content: On the fourth death anniversary of Father Stan Swamy, a statue in his honour was unveiled at the St. Peter’s Higher Secondary School in his native village of Viragalur

title: Edappadi K. Palaniswami renews call for like-minded parties to join hands against DMK
content: He says the AIADMK will lead the coalition and form the government after it wins the Assembly election in 2026, and that he will be the Chief Ministerial candidate

title: Farming activity gains pace in Cauvery delta for Kuruvai season
content: Comfortable storage in reservoirs has boosted agricultural operations this year; as on Saturday morning, the Mettur dam had 93 tmcft of storage, barely half a tmcft short of its full capacity

title: PM Modi, Argentine President Milei agree to diversify bilateral trade basket
content: In their wide-ranging talks, the two leaders emphasised on boosting defence cooperation between the two countries as it will serve each other's strategic interests.

title: Prove that Forest Rights Act is responsible for ‘negative’ change to forest cover, Tribal Affairs Ministry tells Environment Ministry
content: The Ministry of Tribal Affairs’ communication comes days after over 150 forest rights and civil society groups wrote to the Centre, taking issue with the latest State of Forest Report attribution of “negative” change in forest cover to FRA

title: A.P. CM orders release of water into Jeedipalli reservoir under HNSS Project from July 15
content: Naidu stresses the need to fully utilise the inflows coming through the HNSS and Pothireddypadu system for filling reservoirs across Rayalaseema

title: Over one crore electors submit enumeration forms in Bihar
content: Over 93% forms distributed to voters for electoral roll revision; RJD leader Rabri Devi says Centre and State trying to snatch voting rights, and appeals to people not to show any document except voter ID to visiting polling staff

title: M.P. High Court reverses lower court order that granted ownership of ancestral properties to Saif Ali Khan, family
content: The matter pertains to a ownership dispute among the descendants of the last ruler of the princely state of Bhopal, Nawab Hamidullah Khan

title: Supreme Court notifies quota for OBCs, SCs and STs in direct staff recruitments
content: The Chief Justice of India extends reservation to the physically challenged, ex-servicemen and dependents of freedom fighters

title: Communal tension grips Rajasthan town after man beaten to death
content: A 25-year-old man allegedly beaten to death in a minor road accident after his car hit a vegetable cart in a market, causing a crowd to thrash him

title: Kolkata law student rape case: Classes to resume at Kolkata’s college as probe continues
content: The classes had been suspended after the college campus, particularly the guard room where the incident allegedly unfolded, had been sealed off for the investigation

title: Ganja chocolate smuggler arrested in Vijayawada
content: Accused Subhash Kumar Yadav of Bihar was taking the chocolates to Chennai, say  the Government Railway Police

title: Questions swirl around poll officers’ powers to flag citizenship issues
content: EC guidelines permit electoral registration officers to report suspected foreigner cases to “competent authorities”, while the Citizenship Act, 1955 grants only the Home Ministry the authority to decide on citizenship issues

title: Suvendu urges R.G. Kar victim’s parents to join march against Mamata
content: After the sexual assault of a law college student in Kolkata in June, the BJP leader urged the parents of the R.G. Kar Hospital rape and murder victim to join the march to the State Secretariat on August 9

title: Congress demands special session of Bihar Assembly, claims State is experiencing “goonda raj” under NDA
content: Congress says special session must also discuss the special intensive revision of electoral rolls, terming it a “deliberate conspiracy” to help the BJP win the Assembly election to be held later this year

title: Nipah virus: 425 people under observation as Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode put on high alert
content: In Palakkad, 61 out of 110 people on the contact list are health workers, while in Kozhikode, all 87 are listed as health workers. Health Minister advises psychological assistance for those on the contact list

title: U.P. launches temple renovation and tourism plan to preserve cultural heritage
content: The government says the Tourism Department has prepared a detailed roadmap to transform many sacred sites in eastern U.P. into vibrant centres of heritage tourism. The focus is on bringing lesser-known ancient temples and pilgrimage sites onto the global tourism map, it emphasises

title: Age-old Jain practice of Santhara | Starved for salvation
content: A petition in the Madhya Pradesh High Court seeks a ban on the Jain practice of Santhara for minors after a three-year-old girl diagnosed with brain tumour died in Indore allegedly within half an hour of undertaking a ‘fast-unto-death’. The Hindu reports on the age-old practice and the current debate

title: Former White Sox pitcher, world champ Jenks dies
content: Bobby Jenks, 44, a former pitcher for the Chicago White Sox who was on the roster when the club won the 2005 World Series, died Friday in Sintra, Portugal, the team announced, months after being diagnosed with adenocarcinoma, a form of stomach cancer.

title: Volpe toss hits Judge as sloppy Yanks fall again
content: Anthony Volpe accidently hit Judge in the face with a toss, one of many mistakes the Yankees made in their 12-6 loss to the Mets for their sixth straight defeat.

title: Bailey shaky in debut, but hustle impresses Jazz
content: Jazz rookie Ace Bailey finished with just eight points in his Salt Lake City Summer League debut, but his willingness to defend and rebound impressed his coaches.

title: Irish land WR Fitzgerald, son of ex-NFL star Larry
content: Devin Fitzgerald, a three-star wide receiver and the son of former NFL star Larry Fitzgerald, has committed to Notre Dame.

title: Rockets trade Whitmore to Wizards, sources say
content: The Houston Rockets are trading Cam Whitmore to the Washington Wizards for two second-round picks, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Grizzlies trading center Huff to Pacers
content: The Memphis Grizzlies are trading center Jay Huff to the Indiana Pacers for one second-round pick and one second-round pick swap, sources told ESPN.

title: Collier denies Unrivaled, WNBA conflict of interest
content: Napheesa Collier pushed back on the idea that she has a conflict of interest as co-founder of Unrivaled and vice president of the WNBPA.

title: Russell, No. 4 WR in 2026, commits to Syracuse
content: Calvin Russell, a four-star receiver ranked No. 28 in the ESPN 300, would be the highest-ranked addition in Syracuse history if he signs later this year.

title: 🏆 USA vs. Mexico: Gold Cup final preview
content: Sunday's Gold Cup final is a reunion for the Concacaf rivals U.S. and Mexico, but who has the edge heading into the festivities at Houston's NRG Stadium? Here's what you need to know.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: Gonzalo García proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo García could be the reason they go all the way.

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: PSG passed one of their most difficult tests of the Club World Cup, overcoming two red cards in 2-0 win over Bayern Munich.

title: Dortmund coach: MetLife field more suited to golf
content: In the eyes of Borussia Dortmund coach Niko Kovač, the MetLife Stadium field was better suited for a round of golf than a match at the Club World Cup.

title: Müller bids Bayern farewell in loss; future unclear
content: Thomas Müller played his last game for Bayern Munich in a loss to PSG in the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup on Saturday.

title: Mbappé stunner sets up Madrid semi with PSG
content: Real Madrid edged Borussia Dortmund 3-2 in a dramatic Club World Cup quarterfinal Saturday to set up a semifinal against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Poch: U.S. needs 'pressure' of final before '26 WC
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said his team needs the "pressure" Sunday's Gold Cup final against Mexico to prepare for next summer's World Cup.

title: Holders England beaten by France in Euros opener
content: Marie-Antoinette Katoto and Sandy Baltimore scored first-half goals as France beat reigning champions England 2-1 in their Women's Euro Group D opener

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Jota funeral: Liverpool squad, family pay respects
content: Family, friends and teammates gathered to pay their respects to Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, whose funerals were held Saturday morning.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: The art of a team talk: Why great captains, coaches use them to teach, not scream
content: From impassioned shouting to calm instructions, team captains and managers attempt to motivate their players by any means necessary. But which messages actually work?

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Wales fans light up Lucerne on tournament debut
content: Wales fans celebrated as they made their tournament debut, but they were no match for Netherlands. Here's what you need to know from Saturday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Leão
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Leão from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Red 'sprite' in space: Nasa astronaut shares elusive atmospheric phenomena
content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. Join us as we craft knowledge with precision and passion, bringing you on a journey where the mysteries of the universe unfold with every word. Read More

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Orioles' lineup gets a boost; Chapman set to return for Giants
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . storms are expected in the area and there could be a delay, though the game will likely play . the Baltimore Orioles lineup received a couple of boosts with Jordan Westburg returning after a five-game absension .

title: EA reveals team ratings, changes to CFB 26 Ultimate Team and H2H modes
content: EA Sports releases more details on the competitive aspects of college football 26 . Ultimate Team mode will feature all-new card art in the upcoming iteration . card legibility, too, has been improved . Solo Battles is replaced by Study Hall as the primary single-player mode .

title: Defending champ England fall at first hurdle, as France send statement
content: France beat defending champions England 2-1 in their euro 2025 group d opener . Marie-Antoinette Katoto and Sandy Baltimore scored for the hosts . the defeat was chalked off due to a toe offside .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Texans' revamped offense coming together heading into training camp
content: the Texans will have a different pass game, multiple rushing schemes and more running in between the tackles . new coordinator Nick Caley will run the show with the texans this offseason . caley says he's in the discovery process when we get to work with them on the field .

title: 'He's trying to get perfection out of me': Jets pushing Sauce Gardner for more
content: the new york Jets ' expectations for Sauce Gardner are reminiscent of the old "Friday Night Lights" movie . he challenged the star cornerback to raise his game to a new level . "the fact that he's trying to get perfection out of me is what I need," he said .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .
